trans-unit.source: Deploy the ARM template by using the Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Deploy the ARM template by using the Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: To deploy the ARM template you downloaded by using PowerShell, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To deploy the ARM template you downloaded by using PowerShell, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: If you have never used Azure CLI, see [Install and Configure the Azure CLI](xplat-cli.md) and follow the instructions up to the point where you select your Azure account and subscription.
trans-unit.target: If you have never used Azure CLI, see [Install and Configure the Azure CLI](xplat-cli.md) and follow the instructions up to the point where you select your Azure account and subscription.

trans-unit.source: Run the **azure config mode** command to switch to Resource Manager mode, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Run the **azure config mode** command to switch to Resource Manager mode, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: If necessary, run the **azure group create** to create a new resource group, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, run the **azure group create** to create a new resource group, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Notice the output of the command.
trans-unit.target: Notice the output of the command.

trans-unit.source: The list shown after the output explains the parameters used.
trans-unit.target: The list shown after the output explains the parameters used.

trans-unit.source: For more information about resource groups, visit [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md/#resource-groups).
trans-unit.target: For more information about resource groups, visit [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md/#resource-groups).

trans-unit.source: **-n (or --name)**.
trans-unit.target: **-n (or --name)**.

trans-unit.source: Name for the new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Name for the new resource group.

trans-unit.source: For our scenario, *TestRG*.
trans-unit.target: For our scenario, *TestRG*.

trans-unit.source: **-l (or --location)**.
trans-unit.target: **-l (or --location)**.

trans-unit.source: Azure region where the new resource group will be created.
trans-unit.target: Azure region where the new resource group will be created.

trans-unit.source: For our scenario, *centralus*.
trans-unit.target: For our scenario, *centralus*.

trans-unit.source: Run the **azure group deployment create** cmdlet to deploy the new VNet by using the template and parameter files you downloaded and modified above.
trans-unit.target: Run the **azure group deployment create** cmdlet to deploy the new VNet by using the template and parameter files you downloaded and modified above.

trans-unit.source: The list shown after the output explains the parameters used.
trans-unit.target: The list shown after the output explains the parameters used.

trans-unit.source: **-g (or --resource-group)**.
trans-unit.target: **-g (or --resource-group)**.

trans-unit.source: Name of the resource group the new VNet will be created in.
trans-unit.target: Name of the resource group the new VNet will be created in.

trans-unit.source: **-f (or --template-file)**.
trans-unit.target: **-f (or --template-file)**.

trans-unit.source: Path to your ARM template file.
trans-unit.target: Path to your ARM template file.

trans-unit.source: **-e (or --parameters-file)**.
trans-unit.target: **-e (or --parameters-file)**.

trans-unit.source: Path to your ARM parameters file.
trans-unit.target: Path to your ARM parameters file.

trans-unit.source: Run the **azure network vnet show** command to view the properties of the new vnet, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Run the **azure network vnet show** command to view the properties of the new vnet, as shown below.
